attributes.mlflow.spanInputs:
{"system_prompt": "You are Roadcast's documentation concierge. Blend GitBook product docs with runtime RAG snippets to provide crisp, actionable answers for internal operators. Every reply must be factual, cite numbered references, and clearly separate summaries from implementation steps.", "user_question": "what are the type of billings in bolt", "snippets": ["[1] Title: Bolt V2 Fleet Management: End-User | Documentation | Roadcast Docs
URL: https://roadcast.gitbook.io/roadcast-docs/documentation
Excerpt: copy
Copy
chevron-down
Bolt V2 Fleet Management: End-User
Real-time fleet intelligence and configurable workflows that keep product owners and consumers moving in sync.
What it is
: Bolt is a unified operations intelligence platform for organizations that manage fleets, field assets, and on-ground personnel. It merges real-time visibility, configurable workflows, and deep reporting into a single web experience.
Who it’s for
:
Product Owners: orchestrate programs, configure roles, and align KPIs.
Portal Operators: run daily operations—devices, trips, notifications, incidents, yard logistics.
Pu", "[2] Title: Live Tracking & Remote Operations | Documentation | Roadcast Docs
URL: https://roadcast.gitbook.io/roadcast-docs/documentation/basic-docs/live-tracking-and-remote-operations
Excerpt: copy
Copy
chevron-down
Basic Docs
Live Tracking & Remote Operations
hashtag
Live Tracking & Remote Operations
The tracking interface utilizes
Leaflet
to provide a high-performance, real-time visualization of your fleet.
Visual Overlays:
Toggle between standard road maps, high-resolution satellite imagery, and live traffic data.
Marker Logic:
Vehicle icons change color dynamically based on state:
Green:
Ignition On / Moving.
Yellow:
Idle (Ignition On but stationary).
Red:
Ignition Off.
Grey:
Inactive (No data received for a set period).
hashtag
Vehicle Marker Legend & Status Logic
This page def", "[3] Title: Home | Roadcast Docs
URL: https://roadcast.gitbook.io/roadcast-docs
Excerpt: copy
Copy
chevron-down
house
Home

circle-info

hashtag

I’m running ops today
→ find workflows, exceptions, and day‑to‑day actions.", "[4] Title: Core Operational Logic & Expected Behaviors | Documentation | Roadcast Docs
URL: https://roadcast.gitbook.io/roadcast-docs/documentation/basic-docs/core-operational-logic-and-expected-behaviors
Excerpt: copy
Copy
chevron-down
Basic Docs
Core Operational Logic & Expected Behaviors
hashtag
Financial & Billing Scenarios (Case 9.1)
The system manages funds differently based on the organization's billing configuration.
Scenario
Mode
Expected Behavior
Financial Impact
Purchase with 0 local balance
Centralized
Success:
The system automatically identifies the Parent Wallet and deducts funds.
Parent Org is charged.
Purchase with 0 local balance

The transaction is blocked instantly.
No charge; user must recharge.

The system verifies the wallet type before"], "format_instructions": "If a query cannot be answered from the provided snippets, say so explicitly and recommend which doc to read.
Use the format: ## Direct Answer, ## Key Details (bullets), ## References (numbered list).
Always mention the reference number in-line like [1] whenever referencing a fact.
Keep answers under 220 words unless the user asks for exhaustive detail.
Highlight commands or API names with backticks.
Never hallucinate URLs; always reuse the snippet URLs provided.
Follow the template strictly:
## Direct Answer
<2-3 sentence summary>
## Key Details
- Bullet fact with inline [number]

## References
[List every reference as [n] Title — URL]
Keep the overall response under 150 words unless the user explicitly asks for a detailed or long explanation."}
attributes.mlflow.spanOutputs:
{"answer_markdown": "## Direct Answer
The provided snippets do not explicitly describe the types of billings in Bolt. However, there is a mention of financial and billing scenarios related to centralized and decentralized billing modes, which affect how funds are managed and transactions are processed.

## Key Details
- In a centralized billing mode, if a purchase is made with zero local balance, the system automatically charges the Parent Wallet, and the Parent Organization is billed.
- In a decentralized billing mode, a purchase with zero local balance fails immediately, blocking the transaction until the user recharges.
- Add-on activations are verified based on wallet type regardless of billing mode [4].

## References
[4] Core Operational Logic & Expected Behaviors — https://roadcast.gitbook.io/roadcast-docs/documentation/basic-docs/core-operational-logic-and-expected-behaviors

If you need detailed information on billing types in Bolt, reviewing the "Core Operational Logic & Expected Behaviors" documentation or the billing-specific sections in the Bolt V2 Fleet Management docs is recommended [4]."}

[[ ## user_question ## ]]

[[ ## completed ## ]]

attributes.mlflow.spanOutputs:
["[[ ## answer_markdown ## ]]
## Direct Answer
The provided snippets do not explicitly describe the types of billings in Bolt. However, there is a mention of financial and billing scenarios related to centralized and decentralized billing modes, which affect how funds are managed and transactions are processed.

## Key Details
- In a centralized billing mode, if a purchase is made with zero local balance, the system automatically charges the Parent Wallet, and the Parent Organization is billed.
- In a decentralized billing mode, a purchase with zero local balance fails immediately, blocking the transaction until the user recharges.
- Add-on activations are verified based on wallet type regardless of billing mode [4].

## References
[4] Core Operational Logic & Expected Behaviors — https://roadcast.gitbook.io/roadcast-docs/documentation/basic-docs/core-operational-logic-and-expected-behaviors

If you need detailed information on billing types in Bolt, reviewing the "Core Operational Logic & Expected Behaviors" documentation or the billing-specific sections in the Bolt V2 Fleet Management docs is recommended [4].

[[ ## completed ## ]]"]
